title: How to share Facebook posts with non-Facebook friends - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are not friends with them already and they are not in your “network” you can’t. Someone you know or that shares your post would have to be in their “network” to see it. Even if they are your friend they are likely to not see it unless it gets it gets a lot of engagement of others. Facebook only shows your post to nearly %7 of your followers starting out with organic post. Often times these are the people closest to you that interact with you the most. This is often times why people decide to go with paid advertising where they can reach targeted people more easily. Hope this helps give you a better understanding. Let me know if you have any more questions or would like to discuss things further.

Even though the service you use is going away, you can still share information you post to Facebook to people who aren’t on Facebook. The easiest one I can think of is to set up an IFTTT trigger that automatically sends an email with the content of new posts you make to anyone you want. How to use IFTTT to blast your Facebook posts over email
